meanings.definition: A person who is easily frightened or nervous.
meanings.sent1: The little williwaus jumped at every noise in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The williwaus hesitated to enter the haunted house.
meanings.sent3: The williwaus screamed when a butterfly landed on their shoulder.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a williwaus surrounded by the loud, bustling crowd.
meanings.sent5: The williwaus shivered at the slightest breeze, always on edge.

meanings.definition: To act in a timid or fearful manner.
meanings.sent1: He williwaused when asked to speak in front of the class.
meanings.sent2: The cat williwaused around the unfamiliar dog.
meanings.sent3: She williwaused before taking the plunge into the cold pool.
meanings.sent4: The leaves williwaused in the wind before falling to the ground.
meanings.sent5: The child williwaused at the sight of the big, barking dog.

meanings.definition: A state of being scared or anxious.
meanings.sent1: The williwaus could feel their heart racing with fear.
meanings.sent2: She experienced a moment of williwaus before the roller coaster started.
meanings.sent3: The williwaus in the horror movie made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a storm of williwaus before the important exam.
meanings.sent5: The dark alley filled her with williwaus as she walked home alone.
